amendment.description: Amendment prohibits the use of any funds appropriated in the bill from being used to demolish, or ban pedestrians from using, the bridge between Jersey City, New Jersey and Ellis Island, so long as the bridge meets generally accepted safety standards.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 48 in the Congressional Record of July 11, 1995, to prohibit the use of any funds appropriated in the bill from being used to demolish, or ban pedestrians from using the bridge from Jersey City and Ellis Island, so long as the bridge meets generally accepted safety standards.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Zimmer amendment (A036) Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 196 (Roll no. 520).
